intro: Hippocrepis valentina, commonly known as the Valentina's bellflower, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
